summary:
Yanling is a technical leader with strong expertise in biologics/medical device development and manufacturing. In the last 18 years, she has led R&D teams in the biotech sector across UK, USA and Australia. Yanling has a track record of bringing discovery projects through development to commercialisation with her versatile skills and experiences covering drug discovery and development, assay development, process development & CMC (Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls), biomanufacturing (cGMP), clinical trials and regulatory. 

Yanling was involved in the development of two commercial antibody therapeutic drugs. She has led the validation program for the FDA approval of a colorectal cancer diagnostic test InSure® ONE™ and more recently played a critical role in the commercial implementation of the prostate cancer diagnostic test MiCheck®. Currently she is helping GlyTherix to develop their anti-glypican-1 antibodies as a targeted radiotherapy. 

Yanling is a passionate individual and enjoys working in a dynamic environment which leverages her cross-disciplinary knowledge.  

Core skills: CMC Program Management & Analytical Validation
•  Expertise in antibody engineering and product characterisation. 
•  Expertise in analytical method development and validation. 
•  Expertise in formulation development, stability testing and drug delivery. 
•  Experienced in bioprocess development and cGMP manufacturing. 
•  Experienced in radiopharmaceutical development.
•  Expertise in IVD test development and validation. 
•  Experienced in point-of-care (POC) rapid test development. 
•  Leadership in technology evaluation and tech transfer. 
•  Accelerating programs from pre-clinical to clinical development. 
•  Proficient in technical writing and QMS documentation.  
•  Conversant with regulatory requirements and guidelines (FDA, EMA, ICH, TGA and CLSI etc). 
•  Effective project management and people management skills.

currentPositions.description:
GlyTherix spun out from Minomic in Sep 2018 as an immuno-oncology company focusing on targeted radiotherapeutics for solid tumours. The company's core IPs are around human glypican-1 antigen and its targeting antibodies Miltuximab and Glytuzumab. GlyTherix is currently developing multiple radiopharmaceutical reagents for treatment of solid tumours. 
• I lead CMC project management and manufacturing strategy implementation. 
• I manage all projects with our contract development and manufacturing organisations (CDMOs). 
• I manage projects on antibody engineering and manufacturing, cell line development, process development, assay validation and product characterisation. 
• I manage bioconjugation programs to generate antibody drug conjugates (ADCs). 
• I involve in project management of the R&D projects and key R&D activities.
• I regularly take part in the preparation of grant applications (e.g. CRC-P, BTB, MMI, ARC etc). 
• I was a key contributor in a $3M CRC-P grant awarded to Glytherix in Jul 2020 for a $12M project on "Manufacturing consortium for cancer radioimmunotherapy". This is currently a key program I project manage all the manufacturing activities for an upcoming Phase Ib trial.
currentPositions.title: Head of CMC (Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls)

headline: Head of CMC | BioManufacturing | Biotech & Medtech | Antibody Therapeutics | Radiopharmaceuticals | Cancer Diagnostics | Product Characterisation & Validation

message.text:
Hey everyone! I’m on the lookout for a new role and would really appreciate your support.

I recently graduated as a GAICD and looking for director roles in companies that need to improve technology, cyber security, governance and processes at a board level. 

I am also open to CIO/CTO roles.

If you hear of any exciting opportunities or are open to chatting, send me a message! #OpenToWork

commentary.text: Congrats Paul McDonald and the team!
